dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3481028W] Stolen Web Content - Please Remove Site 70.85.181.50
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringeme
nt%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, March 13, 2007 8:55 PM
To: DMCA
Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3481028W] Stolen Web Content - Please Remove
Site 70.85.181.50

==== Forwarded Ticket ====
1. Stolen Web Content - Please Remove Site 70.85.181.50

Subject: Stolen Web Content - Please Remove Site 70.85.181.50  
Date: Wed, 14 Mar 2007 01:10:14 -0400

        boundary="----=_NextPart_000_017F_01C765D5.87C9D7A0"

FILETIME=[73E678C0:01C765F7] 

 (multipart/alternative) 
Multipart prefix (text/plain) 
This is a multipart message in MIME format. 
 
MIME element (text/plain) 
Dear Sirs or Madams: 
  
I am writing you on behalf of my company Business Training Works.com.
You 
are hosting a site (http://vembassy.com) that has stolen large portions
of 
our content.  They have also stolen from The Boston Consulting Group and
AC 
Nielsen.  They have promised to remove our content for over a month and 
still have not followed through.  I have pasted the conversation thread 
below my signature for your review.   
  
The public relations firm referenced in the thread (grafdom.com) lists
the 
same contact number in Dubai as the Visionary Embassy website and uses
the 
same IP Address (70.85.181.50 )which you also host.  The content from
that 
site is also largely stolen from other sources - just not us. 
  
If you are unable to remove their site from your server, we will have no

choice but to file a complaint in accordance with the Digital Millennium

Copyright Act.  Their activity is affecting our website's ranking and 
business in the Middle East.  I thank you in advance for your
cooperation.   
  
Kind regards, 
  
Kate Zabriskie 
Business Training Works, Inc. 
9015 Katie Court 
Port Tobacco, MD 20677 
  
Phone: 301.934.3250 
Fax: 208.445.5379 
  
Download course outlines at www.businesstrainingworks.com.  
  
TAX ID: 020615845 
DUNS: 139115625 
  
Dear Farid: 
  
Our materials are still on your site.  Please remove them immediately
from 
www.vembassy.com.  I have copied Stuart Wilford on this email as well.
With 
an office in the United States, Grafdom is subject to all copyright 
regulations under US law. 
  
Stuart, you and I have not been in touch.  The email thread below
basically 
outlines the problem.  Grafdom, the creators of the www.vembassy.com
site 
have used content from www.businesstrainingworks.com.   
  
I have asked repeatedly to have the content removed. 
  
I am working in Kuwait this week.  When I return, if the content is not 
removed, we will pursue legal action.  www.vembassy.com has been aware
of 
this problem for almost a month.  Removing a site is a three-minute 
activity.  
  
Sincerely, 
  
Kate Zabriskie 
Business Training Works, Inc. 
9015 Katie Court 
Port Tobacco, MD 20677 
  
Phone: 301.934.3250 
Fax: 208.445.5379 
  
Download course outlines at www.businesstrainingworks.com.  
  
TAX ID: 020615845 
DUNS: 139115625 
  
From: Farid Gasim [mailto:azsa13@gmail.com]  
Sent: Tuesday, February 20, 2007 2:52 AM 
To: Kate Zabriskie 
Subject: Re: Remove Our Content from Your Site 
  
Dear Kate,  
  
We are seeking to resolve this matter at the earliest, the PR agency has

confirmed to having this rectified by the end of this week (friday). 
I do apologize again for the inconvenience caused.  
Your approach seems intriguing, we would like to seek ways that we could

implement this approach, to ensure all the content is genuine. Is there
any 
particular product or service you sell? 
  
With Regards, 
Farid Gasim.  
 
  
On 2/19/07, Kate Zabriskie <kzabriskie@businesstrainingworks.com> wrote:

Dear Farid: 
  
The content is still there.  Please advise when you will remove it.  It
is 
blatant theft.  Please be aware that virtually all of your content has
been 
lifted from other sites.  We regularly search for duplicate content.
That 
is how we discovered our pages on your site.  
  
Kind regards, 
  
Kate Zabriskie 
Business Training Works, Inc. 
9015 Katie Court  
Port Tobacco, MD 20677 
  
Phone: 301.934.3250 
Fax: 208.445.5379 
  
Download course outlines at www.businesstrainingworks.com 
<http://www.businesstrainingworks.com/> .  
  
TAX ID: 020615845 
DUNS: 139115625 
  
  _____   
 
From: Farid Gasim [mailto: azsa13@gmail.com]  
Sent: Friday, February 16, 2007 1:31 PM 
To: Kate Zabriskie 
Subject: Re: Remove Our Content from Your Site 
  
Dear Ms. Kathryn, 
  
I acknowledge receipt of your email, and following my evaluation take 
complete responsibility for the issue at hand. We will instruct our PR 
agency, which was appointed as being incharge of material and copyright,
to 
amend the content that we do not rightfully own. I thank you for
outlining 
this very crucial aspect of our operations, and i assure its being
dealth 
with at the highest priority.  
  
We will proceed as necessary to make the due changes, and i would
presume 
this matter to be resolved before the end of this week (by Thursday).  
  
Also, if you wouldnt mind, could you kindly let me know how you found
out 
this content breach. We would like to know the process you had enacted,
as 
we would intend to conduct the same, when the new material is uploaded,
just 
to ensure its genuinity.  
  
With Regards, 
Farid Gasim. 
 
  
On 2/15/07, Kate Zabriskie < kzabriskie@businesstrainingworks.com 
<mailto:kzabriskie@businesstrainingworks.com> > wrote:  
14 February 2007 
  
  
Mr. Farid Gasim  
Dune Center 
Off. 5 
Dyafa Road Satwa 
Dubai 211156 
  
Dear Mr. Gasim: 
  
It has come to my attention that you have made an unauthorized use of
our 
training program outlines which we publish on
www.businesstrainingworks.com 
<http://www.businesstrainingworks.com/> .  These outlines are
copyrighted 
content.  
  
The outlines that appear on www.vembassy.com <http://www.vembassy.com/> 
are identical those posted on our site.  You neither asked for nor
received 
permission to use them or to make or distribute copies of them.  
  
We demand that you immediately remove our content from your site. If I
have 
not received an affirmative response from you by 16 February 2007
indicating 
that you have fully complied with these requirements, I shall consider 
taking the full legal remedies available to rectify this situation.  
  
Sincerely, 
Kathryn Zabriskie 
  
Kathryn Zabriskie 
President
